|stockos = Linux;2.6.22;; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0,Mini PCIe |exp_minipcie_num = 1 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = boot log |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = |defaultssid = dlink-XXXX,dlink-media-XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^dlink-[A-F0-9]{4}$,,,^dlink-media-[A-F0-9]{4}$ |default_ch = |manuf = Alpha Networks |manuf_model = WRG-AC01 |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = FreshTomato, [http://www.linksysinfo.org/index.php?threads/new-tomato-firmware-for-d-link-dir-865l-ac1750-router.70230/ vineyard's custom Tomato version] |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/15/2012 |estreldate = 07/2/2012 |estprice = 189.99 |upc = 790069379710 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B008DWCRQW |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Alpha Networks WMC-AC01 |rad1modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TT1235 P10, 228685 6 B W; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331;BCM4331KMLG, TE1232 P21, 223553 3 W; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "8WRGAC01.2A1G" is silkscreened on the back of the main board. :The main board is using '''TAICON''' electrolytic capacitors. "8WMCAC01.2A1G" is silkscreened on the 802.11ac wireless module in the FCC photos. The default SSID patterns for the device are '''dlink-XXXX''' and '''dlink-media-XXXX'''. '''XXXX''' is the last two octets of the respective wireless interface's MAC address (upper case letters). The power adapter shown in the FCC photos (and presumably the one included with the device) is an '''Asian Power Devices''' WA-36C12R (100-240VAC ~ 50â€“60 Hz, 1A Max. -> 12VDC, 3A). {{WiFiCert|WFA15518|07/20/2012}} ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The pinout seems to be the standard current '''Alpha''' pinout. 
JP2
[RxD]     [3.3][GND][TxD]
{{/Serial info}} ==Pictures==
